reinforcement:
⚠️ COZY RETREAT — KEY RULES FOR IMAGE GENERATION:
- CRITICAL: The Bed must be centered on the wall OPPOSITE the door — it's the first thing you see entering.
- Center the Bed with one nightstand on each side (left AND right).
- CRITICAL: The Sofa MUST be at the FOOT of the bed (the end away from the headboard), facing the bed. Bed + sofa form ONE unified lounging block.
- Tuck the Table/Desk into a far corner, out of the main sightline from the door.
- Sofa faces INWARD toward the bed, NOT toward a wall.
- The output MUST look visibly DIFFERENT from the input image.

full_prompt:
TASK: Edit this 2D top-down floor plan to show the "Cozy Retreat" arrangement.

╔══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║  ⚠️  STRICT RULES                                            ║
╠══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╣
║  1. Exactly 14 movable items must appear.           ║
║  2. REQUIRED: [table, chair, chair, sofa, artwork, bed, nightstand, nightstand, plant, artwork, rug, rug, lamp, lamp]                             ║
║  3. DO NOT ADD or REMOVE any furniture.                      ║
║  4. DOOR (north (top) at ~46%): 2+ feet clear.               ║
║  5. DO NOT MOVE: [refrigerator, kitchen cabinet, kitchen sink, stovetop, door, sink, sink, toilet, shower, shelf, window, window, window]                             ║
║  6. OUTPUT = 2D TOP-DOWN VIEW (not 3D).                      ║
╚══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝

⚠️ DO NOT DUPLICATE FURNITURE:
- This room has exactly: 1 table, 2 chairs, 1 sofa, 2 artworks, 1 bed, 2 nightstands, 1 plant, 2 rugs, 2 lamps.
- MOVE = ERASE from old spot + PLACE in new spot. Do NOT copy.
- If the same item appears in TWO places, the output is INVALID.
- COUNT each furniture type before finishing. Counts must match input.

⚠️ EXCLUSION ZONES — furniture MUST NOT overlap these fixed fixtures:
  - refrigerator (refrigerator_1): fixed at top (north)-left (west). NO furniture here.
  - toilet (toilet_1): fixed at top (north)-right (east). NO furniture here.
  - shower (shower_1): fixed at top (north)-right (east). NO furniture here.

STYLE: Cozy Retreat
This layout creates a 'Cozy Retreat' by establishing a unified lounging and sleeping block as the central feature. The bed is positioned as the focal point upon entry, and the sofa is placed at its foot to form an intimate, multi-functional relaxation zone. The work area is intentionally tucked into a corner to keep the main space dedicated to comfort and rest.

FURNITURE PLACEMENT — FOLLOW EXACTLY:
  • BED_1: Centered on the south wall, with the headboard positioned between the two low windows, serving as the focal point when entering the room.
  • NIGHTSTAND_1: Positioned to the left of the head of bed_1, against the south wall.
  • NIGHTSTAND_2: Positioned to the right of the head of bed_1, against the south wall.
  • SOFA_1: Positioned at the foot of bed_1, facing the bed to form a unified lounging area. Ensure a 2-3 foot walkway between the sofa and the bed for comfortable passage.
  • TABLE_1: Tucked into the southwest corner of the room, keeping the main walkway from the entrance clear and out of the primary sightline.
  • CHAIR_1: Placed at table_1. Keep tucked under when not in use to maximize floor space.
  • CHAIR_2: Placed at table_1. Keep tucked under when not in use to maximize floor space.
  • ARTWORK_1: Mounted on the west wall, centered above table_1 to create a distinct work/dining vignette.
  • ARTWORK_2: Center a large piece of art on the now-open east wall to visually balance the room.
  • PLANT_1: Placed in the northeast corner, adding life and filling the space between the main living area and the bathroom entrance.
  • RUG_1: Place a large area rug centered under the bed and sofa combination, extending at least 24 inches beyond the sides and foot to anchor the entire relaxation zone.
  • RUG_2: Place a smaller rug under table_1 and its chairs to visually define the work/dining zone.
  • LAMP_1: Placed on top of nightstand_1.
  • LAMP_2: Placed on top of nightstand_2.

ZONES:
  • work_zone: Contained in the southwest corner of the room, keeping it functionally separate from the primary relaxation area.
  • sleep_zone: Located along the south wall, making it the central focal point of the room as intended.
  • living_zone: Integrated directly with the sleep zone in the center of the room, forming a cohesive block for relaxation. Decorative elements are placed along the perimeter walls to complement this central feature.

⚠️ COZY RETREAT — KEY RULES FOR IMAGE GENERATION:
- CRITICAL: The Bed must be centered on the wall OPPOSITE the door — it's the first thing you see entering.
- Center the Bed with one nightstand on each side (left AND right).
- CRITICAL: The Sofa MUST be at the FOOT of the bed (the end away from the headboard), facing the bed. Bed + sofa form ONE unified lounging block.
- Tuck the Table/Desk into a far corner, out of the main sightline from the door.
- Sofa faces INWARD toward the bed, NOT toward a wall.
- The output MUST look visibly DIFFERENT from the input image.

DOOR CLEARANCE: The main walkway from the door into the room is kept completely clear. All furniture is arranged in the southern and western portions of the room, ensuring an unobstructed path from the entrance.

STRUCTURAL (fixed): Door=north (top) at ~46%, Window=interior at ~50%, Others=[refrigerator, kitchen cabinet, kitchen sink, stovetop, door, sink, sink, toilet, shower, shelf, window, window, window]

OUTPUT: Same 2D style as input, all 14 items in their NEW positions, professional floor plan.
Do NOT place furniture on top of kitchen appliances, bathroom fixtures, or any structural element.
Edit the floor plan to show "Cozy Retreat".
